content:
y 7, 2016
												2.3/10 - A Low-End Tycoon GameI hope my Sims had more fun at the carnival than I did! This game simulates running a carnival. You can choose state fair, parking lot or backyard... Woohoo! There is also a finite amount of items you can place and no development creativity of your carnival except for placement. For this reason I can't recommend this game. It's really boring, and way overpriced. You can typically find this game in simulator bundles for cheap to nothing. Worth $0.30 or so. number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
24, 2016
												It's easy to tell why this is bad - the publisher is ValuSoft - notorious for shovelware.This is no exception!  Obviously it wants to be Roller Coaster Tycoon/Theme Park but without the ability for the player to design custom roller coasters.   Off to a great start! It gets worse.  There's only about 30 objects you can place, and it doesn't really matter where you put them.  You don't need to worry about paths and things, guests just sort of wander in and bounce around.  At best, the game is whackamole as you click through the awful interface to try get your carnies to fix everything.   The buildings are all managed the same way, so there's basically zero differentiation.   Gameplay is overall terrible.Graphics - ho hum, awful, even for the time.Technical problems - it doesn't run in full screen even if you choose that option, it's always in a window.  Unfortunately, this doesn't prevent you from playing the game.Impossible to recommend - there's so many better games in the genre.
